import java.io.File
import kotlin.math.max

fun parseLine(line: String): Triple<String, List<List<Int>>, List<Int>> {
    val l = line.trim()
    val m = Regex("\\s*\\[([^\\]]+)\\]\\s*(.*)\\{([^\\}]*)\\}\\s*").matchEntire(l)
        ?: throw IllegalArgumentException("Cannot parse line: $line")
    val pattern = m.groupValues[1]
    val middle = m.groupValues[2]
    val joltsStr = m.groupValues[3].trim()
    val buttons = mutableListOf<List<Int>>()
    val par = Regex("\\(([^\\)]*)\\)")
    for (mt in par.findAll(middle)) {
        val s = mt.groupValues[1].trim()
        if (s.isEmpty()) buttons.add(emptyList()) else buttons.add(s.split(',').map { it.trim().toInt() })
    }
    val joltages = if (joltsStr.isEmpty()) emptyList() else joltsStr.split(',').map { it.trim().toInt() }
    return Triple(pattern, buttons, joltages)
}

fun mitmMinPresses(pattern: String, buttons: List<List<Int>>): Int {
    val m = pattern.length
    var target = 0
    for (i in 0 until m) if (pattern[i] == '#') target = target or (1 shl i)
    val masks = IntArray(buttons.size)
    for (i in buttons.indices) {
        var mask = 0
        for (idx in buttons[i]) if (idx in 0 until m) mask = mask xor (1 shl idx)
        masks[i] = mask
    }
    val n = masks.size
    val k = n / 2
    val left = masks.sliceArray(0 until k)
    val right = masks.sliceArray(k until n)
    val mapR = HashMap<Int, Int>()
    val Rn = right.size
    for (s in 0 until (1 shl Rn)) {
        var x = 0
        var cnt = 0
        var t = s
        var j = 0
        while (j < Rn) {
            if ((t and 1) != 0) { x = x xor right[j]; cnt++ }
            t = t ushr 1
            j++
        }
        val prev = mapR[x]
        if (prev == null || cnt < prev) mapR[x] = cnt
    }
    var best: Int? = null
    val Ln = left.size
    for (s in 0 until (1 shl Ln)) {
        var x = 0
        var cnt = 0
        var t = s
        var j = 0
        while (j < Ln) {
            if ((t and 1) != 0) { x = x xor left[j]; cnt++ }
            t = t ushr 1
            j++
        }
        val need = x xor target
        val r = mapR[need]
        if (r != null) {
            val total = cnt + r
            if (best == null || total < best!!) best = total
        }
    }
    return best ?: if (target == 0) 0 else Int.MAX_VALUE
}

class Part2ExactDFS(private val buttonsOrig: List<List<Int>>, private val targetsOrig: IntArray) {
    private var n = 0
    private var m = 0
    private lateinit var rowsOf: Array<IntArray> // per button: classes
    private lateinit var masks: IntArray // per button: bitmask over classes
    private lateinit var caps: Array<IntArray> // caps[depth][T]
    private lateinit var order: IntArray
    private lateinit var targets: IntArray // per class

    private fun build(): Boolean {
        val m0 = targetsOrig.size
        val n0 = buttonsOrig.size
        if (m0 == 0) { n = 0; m = 0; targets = IntArray(0); rowsOf = arrayOf(); masks = IntArray(0); caps = arrayOf(); order = IntArray(0); return true }
        // Build cover matrix cover[b][i]
        val cover = Array(n0) { BooleanArray(m0) }
        for (b in 0 until n0) {
            for (idx in buttonsOrig[b]) if (idx in 0 until m0) cover[b][idx] = true
        }
        // signature per row over buttons
        val sigToRows = LinkedHashMap<Long, MutableList<Int>>()
        for (i in 0 until m0) {
            var sig = 0L
            for (b in 0 until n0) if (cover[b][i]) sig = sig or (1L shl b)
            sigToRows.computeIfAbsent(sig) { ArrayList() }.add(i)
        }
        // Map signatures to classes and build targets per class; check consistency
        m = sigToRows.size
        targets = IntArray(m)
        val sigList = ArrayList<Long>(m)
        var ci = 0
        for ((sig, rows) in sigToRows) {
            sigList.add(sig)
            var t = targetsOrig[rows[0]]
            for (r in rows) if (targetsOrig[r] != t) return false // infeasible
            targets[ci] = t
            ci++
        }
        // Remove buttons that touch any class with target 0 (they can never be pressed) and build masks rowsOf
        val forbiddenClassMask = run {
            var msk = 0
            for (i in 0 until m) if (targets[i] == 0) msk = msk or (1 shl i)
            msk
        }
        val tmpMasks = ArrayList<Int>()
        val tmpRowsOf = ArrayList<IntArray>()
        for (b in 0 until n0) {
            // Determine class-coverage mask of button b
            var msk = 0
            for ((idxSig, sig) in sigList.withIndex()) if (((sig ushr b) and 1L) != 0L) msk = msk or (1 shl idxSig)
            if (msk == 0) continue // useless button
            if ((msk and forbiddenClassMask) != 0) continue // pressing would violate zeros
            tmpMasks.add(msk)
            // rows list
            val list = ArrayList<Int>()
            var t = msk
            var j = 0
            while (t != 0) {
                if ((t and 1) != 0) list.add(j)
                t = t ushr 1
                j++
            }
            tmpRowsOf.add(list.toIntArray())
        }
        // Merge duplicate buttons by class mask
        val mapMaskIdx = LinkedHashMap<Int, Int>()
        val mergedMasks = ArrayList<Int>()
        val mergedRows = ArrayList<IntArray>()
        for (idxBtn in tmpMasks.indices) {
            val msk = tmpMasks[idxBtn]
            val at = mapMaskIdx[msk]
            if (at == null) {
                mapMaskIdx[msk] = mergedMasks.size
                mergedMasks.add(msk)
                mergedRows.add(tmpRowsOf[idxBtn])
            } else {
                // duplicate mask: skip (both equivalent)
            }
        }
        // Sort buttons by descending coverage size
        val idxs = (0 until mergedMasks.size).toMutableList()
        idxs.sortWith(compareByDescending { Integer.bitCount(mergedMasks[it]) })
        n = idxs.size
        masks = IntArray(n)
        rowsOf = Array(n) { IntArray(0) }
        for (k in 0 until n) {
            val b = idxs[k]
            masks[k] = mergedMasks[b]
            rowsOf[k] = mergedRows[b]
        }
        order = IntArray(n) { it }
        // Precompute caps for suffixes
        val M = 1 shl m
        caps = Array(n + 1) { IntArray(M) }
        // caps at depth n are zeros
        for (d in n - 1 downTo 0) {
            val prev = caps[d + 1]
            val cur = caps[d]
            // For each subset T, max of prev[T] and coverage by current button on T
            val maskB = masks[d]
            for (T in 1 until M) {
                val cov = Integer.bitCount(maskB and T)
                val v = prev[T]
                cur[T] = if (cov > v) cov else v
            }
        }
        return true
    }

    private fun lb(rem: IntArray, depth: Int): Int {
        val M = 1 shl m
        val cap = caps[depth]
        // compute sums over subsets from rem
        val sumT = IntArray(M)
        for (i in 0 until m) {
            val bit = 1 shl i
            val ri = rem[i]
            for (T in 0 until M) {
                if ((T and bit) != 0) sumT[T] += ri
            }
        }
        var best = 0
        for (T in 1 until M) {
            val s = sumT[T]
            if (s == 0) continue
            val c = cap[T]
            if (c == 0) return Int.MAX_VALUE // infeasible with remaining buttons
            val v = (s + c - 1) / c
            if (v > best) best = v
        }
        return best
    }

    private fun allZero(a: IntArray): Boolean { for (x in a) if (x != 0) return false; return true }

    private fun greedyUpper(rem0: IntArray): Int {
        val rem = rem0.clone()
        var presses = 0
        while (true) {
            if (allZero(rem)) return presses
            var bestB = -1
            var bestGain = 0
            for (b in 0 until n) {
                val rows = rowsOf[b]
                var gain = 0
                for (r in rows) gain += rem[r]
                if (gain > bestGain) { bestGain = gain; bestB = b }
            }
            if (bestB == -1 || bestGain == 0) return Int.MAX_VALUE
            var k = Int.MAX_VALUE
            for (r in rowsOf[bestB]) if (rem[r] < k) k = rem[r]
            if (k <= 0) return Int.MAX_VALUE
            for (r in rowsOf[bestB]) rem[r] -= k
            presses += k
        }
    }

    private data class Key(val depth: Int, val state: IntArray) {
        override fun equals(other: Any?): Boolean {
            if (this === other) return true
            if (other !is Key) return false
            if (depth != other.depth) return false
            if (state.size != other.state.size) return false
            for (i in state.indices) if (state[i] != other.state[i]) return false
            return true
        }
        override fun hashCode(): Int {
            var h = depth * 31 + state.size
            for (x in state) h = h * 1000003 + x
            return h
        }
    }

    private val seen = HashMap<Key, Int>()

    private var bestAns = Int.MAX_VALUE

    private fun dfs(depth: Int, rem: IntArray, used: Int) {
        if (used >= bestAns) return
        val h = lb(rem, depth)
        if (h == Int.MAX_VALUE) return
        if (used + h >= bestAns) return
        if (depth == n) {
            if (allZero(rem)) {
                if (used < bestAns) bestAns = used
            }
            return
        }
        val key = Key(depth, rem.clone())
        val prev = seen[key]
        if (prev != null && used >= prev) return
        seen[key] = used
        // compute ub for this button
        val rows = rowsOf[depth]
        var ub = Int.MAX_VALUE
        for (r in rows) if (rem[r] < ub) ub = rem[r]
        if (ub == Int.MAX_VALUE) ub = 0
        // try from ub down to 0
        var k = ub
        while (k >= 0) {
            if (k > 0) for (r in rows) rem[r] -= k
            dfs(depth + 1, rem, used + k)
            if (k > 0) for (r in rows) rem[r] += k
            k--
        }
    }

    fun solve(): Int {
        if (!build()) return Int.MAX_VALUE
        val rem = targets.clone()
        // quick feasibility: rows with t>0 must have some covering remaining button (captured by lb at depth 0 returning INF)
        bestAns = greedyUpper(rem)
        if (bestAns == Int.MAX_VALUE) return Int.MAX_VALUE
        seen.clear()
        dfs(0, rem, 0)
        return bestAns
    }
}

fun main() {
    val text = File("input.txt").readText()
    var total1 = 0
    var total2 = 0
    for (raw in text.trim().lines()) {
        val line = raw.trim()
        if (line.isEmpty()) continue
        val (pattern, buttons, jolts) = parseLine(line)
        total1 += mitmMinPresses(pattern, buttons)
        total2 += Part2ExactDFS(buttons, jolts.toIntArray()).solve()
    }
    println(total1)
    println(total2)
}

fun parseLine(line: String): Triple<String, List<List<Int>>, List<Int>> {
    val l = line.trim()
    val m = Regex("\\s*\\[([^\\]]+)\\]\\s*(.*)\\{([^\\}]*)\\}\\s*").matchEntire(l)
        ?: throw IllegalArgumentException("Cannot parse line: $line")
    val pattern = m.groupValues[1]
    val middle = m.groupValues[2]
    val joltsStr = m.groupValues[3].trim()
    val buttons = mutableListOf<List<Int>>()
    val par = Regex("\\(([^\\)]*)\\)")
    for (mt in par.findAll(middle)) {
        val s = mt.groupValues[1].trim()
        if (s.isEmpty()) buttons.add(emptyList()) else buttons.add(s.split(',').map { it.trim().toInt() })
    }

    return Triple(pattern, buttons, joltages)
}

fun mitmMinPresses(pattern: String, buttons: List<List<Int>>): Int {
    val m = pattern.length
    var target = 0
    for (i in 0 until m) if (pattern[i] == '#') target = target or (1 shl i)
    val masks = IntArray(buttons.size)
    for (i in buttons.indices) {
        var mask = 0
        for (idx in buttons[i]) if (idx in 0 until m) mask = mask xor (1 shl idx)
        masks[i] = mask
    }
    val n = masks.size
    val k = n / 2
    val left = masks.sliceArray(0 until k)
    val right = masks.sliceArray(k until n)
    val mapR = HashMap<Int, Int>()
    val Rn = right.size
    for (s in 0 until (1 shl Rn)) {
        var x = 0
        var cnt = 0
        var t = s
        var j = 0
        while (j < Rn) {
            if ((t and 1) != 0) { x = x xor right[j]; cnt++ }
            t = t ushr 1
            j++
        }
        val prev = mapR[x]
        if (prev == null || cnt < prev) mapR[x] = cnt
    }
    var best: Int? = null
    val Ln = left.size
    for (s in 0 until (1 shl Ln)) {
        var x = 0
        var cnt = 0
        var t = s
        var j = 0
        while (j < Ln) {
            if ((t and 1) != 0) { x = x xor left[j]; cnt++ }
            t = t ushr 1
            j++
        }
        val need = x xor target
        val r = mapR[need]
        if (r != null) {
            val total = cnt + r
            if (best == null || total < best!!) best = total
        }
    }
    return best ?: if (target == 0) 0 else Int.MAX_VALUE
}

class Part2ExactDFS(private val buttonsOrig: List<List<Int>>, private val targetsOrig: IntArray) {
    private var n = 0
    private var m = 0
    private lateinit var rowsOf: Array<IntArray>
    private lateinit var masks: IntArray
    private lateinit var caps: Array<IntArray>
    private lateinit var order: IntArray
    private lateinit var targets: IntArray

    private fun build(): Boolean {
        val m0 = targetsOrig.size
        val n0 = buttonsOrig.size
        if (m0 == 0) { n = 0; m = 0; targets = IntArray(0); rowsOf = arrayOf(); masks = IntArray(0); caps = arrayOf(); order = IntArray(0); return true }
        val cover = Array(n0) { BooleanArray(m0) }
        for (b in 0 until n0) for (idx in buttonsOrig[b]) if (idx in 0 until m0) cover[b][idx] = true
        val sigToRows = LinkedHashMap<Long, MutableList<Int>>()
        for (i in 0 until m0) {
            var sig = 0L
            for (b in 0 until n0) if (cover[b][i]) sig = sig or (1L shl b)
            sigToRows.computeIfAbsent(sig) { ArrayList() }.add(i)
        }
        m = sigToRows.size
        targets = IntArray(m)
        val sigList = ArrayList<Long>(m)
        var ci = 0
        for ((sig, rows) in sigToRows) {
            sigList.add(sig)
            val t = targetsOrig[rows[0]]
            for (r in rows) if (targetsOrig[r] != t) return false
            targets[ci] = t
            ci++
        }
        // cannot press buttons that affect zero-target classes
        var forbiddenMask = 0
        for (i in 0 until m) if (targets[i] == 0) forbiddenMask = forbiddenMask or (1 shl i)
        val tmpMasks = ArrayList<Int>()
        val tmpRows = ArrayList<IntArray>()
        for (b in 0 until n0) {
            var msk = 0
            for ((idxSig, sig) in sigList.withIndex()) if (((sig ushr b) and 1L) != 0L) msk = msk or (1 shl idxSig)
            if (msk == 0) continue
            if ((msk and forbiddenMask) != 0) continue
            tmpMasks.add(msk)
            val list = ArrayList<Int>()
            var t = msk
            var j = 0
            while (t != 0) { if ((t and 1) != 0) list.add(j); t = t ushr 1; j++ }
            tmpRows.add(list.toIntArray())
        }
        // if any class has t>0 but no remaining button touches it -> infeasible
        for (i in 0 until m) {
            if (targets[i] == 0) continue
            var any = false
            for (k in tmpMasks.indices) if (((tmpMasks[k] ushr i) and 1) != 0) { any = true; break }
            if (!any) return false
        }
        // merge duplicate button masks
        val mapMaskIdx = LinkedHashMap<Int, Int>()
        val mergedMasks = ArrayList<Int>()
        val mergedRows = ArrayList<IntArray>()
        for (idxBtn in tmpMasks.indices) {
            val msk = tmpMasks[idxBtn]
            val at = mapMaskIdx[msk]
            if (at == null) { mapMaskIdx[msk] = mergedMasks.size; mergedMasks.add(msk); mergedRows.add(tmpRows[idxBtn]) }
        }
        // sort by coverage size desc
        val idxs = (0 until mergedMasks.size).toMutableList()
        idxs.sortWith(compareByDescending { Integer.bitCount(mergedMasks[it]) })
        n = idxs.size
        masks = IntArray(n)
        rowsOf = Array(n) { IntArray(0) }
        for (k in 0 until n) { val b = idxs[k]; masks[k] = mergedMasks[b]; rowsOf[k] = mergedRows[b] }
        order = IntArray(n) { it }
        val M = 1 shl m
        caps = Array(n + 1) { IntArray(M) }
        for (d in n - 1 downTo 0) {
            val prev = caps[d + 1]
            val cur = caps[d]
            val maskB = masks[d]
            for (T in 1 until M) {
                val cov = Integer.bitCount(maskB and T)
                val v = prev[T]
                cur[T] = if (cov > v) cov else v
            }
        }
        return true
    }

    private fun lb(rem: IntArray, depth: Int): Int {
        val M = 1 shl m
        val cap = caps[depth]
        val sumT = IntArray(M)
        for (i in 0 until m) {
            if (rem[i] == 0) continue
            val bit = 1 shl i
            val ri = rem[i]
            var T = bit
            while (T < M) {
                sumT[T] += ri
                T = (T + 1) or bit
            }
        }
        var best = 0
        for (T in 1 until M) {
            val s = sumT[T]
            if (s == 0) continue
            val c = cap[T]
            if (c == 0) return Int.MAX_VALUE
            val v = (s + c - 1) / c
            if (v > best) best = v
        }
        return best
    }

    private fun allZero(a: IntArray): Boolean { for (x in a) if (x != 0) return false; return true }

    private var bestAns = Int.MAX_VALUE

    private fun dfs(depth: Int, rem: IntArray, used: Int) {
        if (used >= bestAns) return
        val h = lb(rem, depth)
        if (h == Int.MAX_VALUE) return
        if (used + h >= bestAns) return
        if (depth == n) {
            if (allZero(rem)) if (used < bestAns) bestAns = used
            return
        }
        // upper bound for this button
        val rows = rowsOf[depth]
        var ub = Int.MAX_VALUE
        for (r in rows) if (rem[r] < ub) ub = rem[r]
        if (ub == Int.MAX_VALUE) ub = 0
        var k = ub
        while (k >= 0) {
            if (k > 0) for (r in rows) rem[r] -= k
            dfs(depth + 1, rem, used + k)
            if (k > 0) for (r in rows) rem[r] += k
            k--
        }
    }

    fun solve(): Int {
        if (!build()) return Int.MAX_VALUE
        val rem = targets.clone()
        bestAns = Int.MAX_VALUE
        dfs(0, rem, 0)
        return bestAns
    }
}

fun capAll(buttons: List<List<Int>>, m: Int): Int {
    var mx = 0
    for (b in buttons) {
        var cnt = 0
        for (v in b) if (v in 0 until m) cnt++
        if (cnt > mx) mx = cnt
    }
    return mx
}

fun main() {
    val text = File("input.txt").readText().trim().lines().filter { it.isNotBlank() }
    var total1 = 0
    var total2 = 0
    var i = 0
    for (line in text) {
        val (pattern, buttons, jolts) = parseLine(line)
        val p1 = mitmMinPresses(pattern, buttons)
        val tarr = jolts.toIntArray()
        val sumT = tarr.sum()
        val cap = capAll(buttons, tarr.size)
        val lbAll = if (cap == 0) 0 else ( (sumT + cap - 1) / cap )
        val p2 = Part2ExactDFS(buttons, tarr).solve()
        println("line ${++i}: p1=$p1, p2=$p2, sumT=$sumT, capAll=$cap, lbAll=$lbAll")
        total1 += p1
        total2 += p2
    }
    println(total1)
    println(total2)
}

import java.io.File
import kotlin.math.max
import kotlin.math.min

fun parseLine(line: String): Triple<String, List<List<Int>>, List<Int>> {
    val l = line.trim()
    val m = Regex("\\s*\\[([^\\]]+)\\]\\s*(.*)\\{([^\\}]*)\\}\\s*").matchEntire(l)
        ?: throw IllegalArgumentException("Cannot parse line: $line")
    val pattern = m.groupValues[1]
    val middle = m.groupValues[2]
    val joltsStr = m.groupValues[3].trim()
    val buttons = mutableListOf<List<Int>>()
    val par = Regex("\\(([^\\)]*)\\)")
    for (mt in par.findAll(middle)) {
        val s = mt.groupValues[1].trim()
        if (s.isEmpty()) buttons.add(emptyList()) else buttons.add(s.split(',').map { it.trim().toInt() })
    }
    val joltages = if (joltsStr.isEmpty()) emptyList() else joltsStr.split(',').map { it.trim().toInt() }
    return Triple(pattern, buttons, joltages)
}

fun mitmMinPresses(pattern: String, buttons: List<List<Int>>): Int {
    val m = pattern.length
    var target = 0
    for (i in 0 until m) if (pattern[i] == '#') target = target or (1 shl i)
    val masks = IntArray(buttons.size)
    for (i in buttons.indices) {
        var mask = 0
        for (idx in buttons[i]) if (idx in 0 until m) mask = mask xor (1 shl idx)
        masks[i] = mask
    }
    val n = masks.size
    val k = n / 2
    val left = masks.sliceArray(0 until k)
    val right = masks.sliceArray(k until n)
    val mapR = HashMap<Int, Int>()
    val Rn = right.size
    for (s in 0 until (1 shl Rn)) {
        var x = 0
        var cnt = 0
        var t = s
        var j = 0
        while (j < Rn) {
            if ((t and 1) != 0) { x = x xor right[j]; cnt++ }
            t = t ushr 1
            j++
        }
        val prev = mapR[x]
        if (prev == null || cnt < prev) mapR[x] = cnt
    }
    var best: Int? = null
    val Ln = left.size
    for (s in 0 until (1 shl Ln)) {
        var x = 0
        var cnt = 0
        var t = s
        var j = 0
        while (j < Ln) {
            if ((t and 1) != 0) { x = x xor left[j]; cnt++ }
            t = t ushr 1
            j++
        }
        val need = x xor target
        val r = mapR[need]
        if (r != null) {
            val total = cnt + r
            if (best == null || total < best!!) best = total
        }
    }
    return best ?: if (target == 0) 0 else Int.MAX_VALUE
}

class Part2OptimSolver(buttonsOrig: List<List<Int>>, targetsOrig: IntArray) {
    private var n = 0
    private var m = 0
    private lateinit var masks: IntArray // per button mask on classes
    private lateinit var rowsOf: Array<IntArray>
    private lateinit var caps: Array<IntArray> // caps[depth][T]
    private lateinit var ct: Array<IntArray> // ct[b][T] = |T ∩ rowsOf[b]|
    private lateinit var rem: IntArray // remaining per class
    private lateinit var sumT: IntArray // over subsets T
    private var bestAns = Int.MAX_VALUE

    private fun build(buttons: List<List<Int>>, targets: IntArray): Boolean {
        val m0 = targets.size
        val n0 = buttons.size
        // Build cover matrix for fast lookup
        val cover = Array(n0) { BooleanArray(m0) }
        for (b in 0 until n0) for (idx in buttons[b]) if (idx in 0 until m0) cover[b][idx] = true
        // Group rows by identical signatures
        val sigToRows = LinkedHashMap<Long, MutableList<Int>>()
        for (i in 0 until m0) {
            var sig = 0L
            for (b in 0 until n0) if (cover[b][i]) sig = sig or (1L shl b)
            sigToRows.computeIfAbsent(sig) { ArrayList() }.add(i)
        }
        m = sigToRows.size
        // Build class targets and check consistency
        val classTargets = IntArray(m)
        val sigList = ArrayList<Long>(m)
        var ci = 0
        for ((sig, rows) in sigToRows) {
            sigList.add(sig)
            val t0 = targets[rows[0]]
            for (r in rows) if (targets[r] != t0) return false
            classTargets[ci] = t0
            ci++
        }
        // Zero-target classes forbid any button touching them
        var forbid = 0
        for (i in 0 until m) if (classTargets[i] == 0) forbid = forbid or (1 shl i)
        // Build button masks over classes, skip those touching forbidden or empty
        val tmpMasks = ArrayList<Int>()
        val tmpRows = ArrayList<IntArray>()
        for (b in 0 until n0) {
            var msk = 0
            for ((idxSig, sig) in sigList.withIndex()) if (((sig ushr b) and 1L) != 0L) msk = msk or (1 shl idxSig)
            if (msk == 0) continue
            if ((msk and forbid) != 0) continue
            tmpMasks.add(msk)
            val list = ArrayList<Int>()
            var t = msk
            var j = 0
            while (t != 0) { if ((t and 1) != 0) list.add(j); t = t ushr 1; j++ }
            tmpRows.add(list.toIntArray())
        }
        // Feasibility: every positive class must be coverable
        for (i in 0 until m) if (classTargets[i] > 0) {
            var any = false
            for (msk in tmpMasks) if (((msk ushr i) and 1) != 0) { any = true; break }
            if (!any) return false
        }
        // Merge duplicate button masks
        val seen = LinkedHashMap<Int, Int>()
        val mergedM = ArrayList<Int>()
        val mergedR = ArrayList<IntArray>()
        for (idxBtn in tmpMasks.indices) {
            val msk = tmpMasks[idxBtn]
            if (!seen.containsKey(msk)) {
                seen[msk] = mergedM.size
                mergedM.add(msk)
                mergedR.add(tmpRows[idxBtn])
            }
        }
        // Sort by coverage size desc
        val order = (0 until mergedM.size).sortedByDescending { Integer.bitCount(mergedM[it]) }
        n = order.size
        masks = IntArray(n)
        rowsOf = Array(n) { IntArray(0) }
        for (k in 0 until n) {
            val b = order[k]
            masks[k] = mergedM[b]
            rowsOf[k] = mergedR[b]
        }
        // Build caps for suffixes
        val M = 1 shl m
        caps = Array(n + 1) { IntArray(M) }
        for (d in n - 1 downTo 0) {
            val prev = caps[d + 1]
            val cur = caps[d]
            val maskB = masks[d]
            for (T in 1 until M) {
                val cov = Integer.bitCount(maskB and T)
                val v = prev[T]
                cur[T] = if (cov > v) cov else v
            }
        }
        // Precompute ct[b][T]
        ct = Array(n) { IntArray(M) }
        for (b in 0 until n) {
            val rows = rowsOf[b]
            for (T in 1 until M) {
                var cnt = 0
                var tt = T
                var irow = 0
                while (tt != 0) {
                    if ((tt and 1) != 0) {
                        if (rows.contains(irow)) cnt++
                    }
                    tt = tt ushr 1
                    irow++
                }
                ct[b][T] = cnt
            }
        }
        rem = classTargets
        sumT = IntArray(M)
        // initialize sumT by adding rem contributions
        for (i in 0 until m) if (rem[i] != 0) {
            val bit = 1 shl i
            var T = bit
            while (T < M) { sumT[T] += rem[i]; T = (T + 1) or bit }
        }
        return true
    }

    private fun lb(depth: Int): Int {
        val cap = caps[depth]
        var best = 0
        for (T in 1 until cap.size) {
            val s = sumT[T]
            if (s == 0) continue
            val c = cap[T]
            if (c == 0) return Int.MAX_VALUE
            val v = (s + c - 1) / c
            if (v > best) best = v
        }
        return best
    }

    private fun allZero(): Boolean { for (x in rem) if (x != 0) return false; return true }

    private fun greedyUpper(): Int {
        val localRem = rem.clone()
        var presses = 0
        while (true) {
            var done = true
            for (x in localRem) if (x != 0) { done = false; break }
            if (done) return presses
            var bestB = -1
            var bestGain = 0
            for (b in 0 until n) {
                var gain = 0
                for (r in rowsOf[b]) gain += localRem[r]
                if (gain > bestGain) { bestGain = gain; bestB = b }
            }
            if (bestB == -1 || bestGain == 0) return Int.MAX_VALUE
            var k = Int.MAX_VALUE
            for (r in rowsOf[bestB]) if (localRem[r] < k) k = localRem[r]
            if (k <= 0) return Int.MAX_VALUE
            for (r in rowsOf[bestB]) localRem[r] -= k
            presses += k
        }
    }

    private fun applyPress(b: Int, k: Int) {
        if (k <= 0) return
        for (r in rowsOf[b]) rem[r] -= k
        val ctb = ct[b]
        for (T in 1 until sumT.size) {
            val c = ctb[T]
            if (c != 0) sumT[T] -= c * k
        }
    }

    private fun undoPress(b: Int, k: Int) {
        if (k <= 0) return
        for (r in rowsOf[b]) rem[r] += k
        val ctb = ct[b]
        for (T in 1 until sumT.size) {
            val c = ctb[T]
            if (c != 0) sumT[T] += c * k
        }
    }

    private fun dfs(depth: Int, used: Int) {
        if (used >= bestAns) return
        val h = lb(depth)
        if (h == Int.MAX_VALUE) return
        if (used + h >= bestAns) return
        if (depth == n) {
            if (allZero()) bestAns = min(bestAns, used)
            return
        }
        val rows = rowsOf[depth]
        var ub = Int.MAX_VALUE
        for (r in rows) if (rem[r] < ub) ub = rem[r]
        if (ub == Int.MAX_VALUE) ub = 0
        var k = ub
        while (k >= 0) {
            applyPress(depth, k)
            dfs(depth + 1, used + k)
            undoPress(depth, k)
            k--
        }
    }

    fun solve(buttons: List<List<Int>>, targets: IntArray): Int {
        if (!build(buttons, targets)) return Int.MAX_VALUE
        bestAns = greedyUpper()
        if (bestAns == Int.MAX_VALUE) bestAns = 1_000_000_000
        dfs(0, 0)
        return bestAns
    }
}

fun main() {
    val text = File("input.txt").readText().trim().lines().filter { it.isNotBlank() }
    var total1 = 0
    var total2 = 0
    for (line in text) {
        val (pattern, buttons, jolts) = parseLine(line)
        total1 += mitmMinPresses(pattern, buttons)
        val solver = Part2OptimSolver(buttons, jolts.toIntArray())
        val p2 = solver.solve(buttons, jolts.toIntArray())
        total2 += p2
    }
    println(total1)
    println(total2)
}

    }

    val Ln = left.size
    for (s in 0 until (1 shl Ln)) {
        var x = 0

private class IntArrayKey(val a: IntArray) {
    override fun equals(other: Any?): Boolean {
        if (this === other) return true
        if (other !is IntArrayKey) return false
        val b = other.a
        if (a.size != b.size) return false
        for (i in a.indices) if (a[i] != b[i]) return false
        return true
    }
    override fun hashCode(): Int {
        var h = a.size
        for (x in a) h = h * 1000003 + x
        return h
    }
}

class Part2AStar(private val buttonsOrig: List<List<Int>>, private val targetsOrig: IntArray) {
    private var n = 0
    private var m = 0
    private lateinit var masks: IntArray // button -> class mask
    private lateinit var rowsOf: Array<IntArray>
    private lateinit var cap: IntArray // over all buttons: cap[T] = max_b popcount(mask_b & T)
    private lateinit var subsetIdxs: Array<IntArray> // list of rows for each T

    private fun build(): Boolean {
        val m0 = targetsOrig.size
        val n0 = buttonsOrig.size
        if (m0 == 0) { n = 0; m = 0; masks = IntArray(0); rowsOf = arrayOf(); cap = IntArray(1); subsetIdxs = arrayOf(); return true }
        // Build cover matrix
        val cover = Array(n0) { BooleanArray(m0) }
        for (b in 0 until n0) for (idx in buttonsOrig[b]) if (idx in 0 until m0) cover[b][idx] = true
        // Group rows by signature
        val sigToRows = LinkedHashMap<Long, MutableList<Int>>()
        for (i in 0 until m0) {
            var sig = 0L
            for (b in 0 until n0) if (cover[b][i]) sig = sig or (1L shl b)
            sigToRows.computeIfAbsent(sig) { ArrayList() }.add(i)
        }
        m = sigToRows.size
        val classTargets = IntArray(m)
        val sigList = ArrayList<Long>(m)
        var ci = 0
        for ((sig, rows) in sigToRows) {
            sigList.add(sig)
            val t0 = targetsOrig[rows[0]]
            for (r in rows) if (targetsOrig[r] != t0) return false // infeasible
            classTargets[ci] = t0
            ci++
        }
        // forbid buttons touching zero-target classes
        var forbid = 0
        for (i in 0 until m) if (classTargets[i] == 0) forbid = forbid or (1 shl i)
        // Build button masks over classes
        val tmpMasks = ArrayList<Int>()
        val tmpRows = ArrayList<IntArray>()
        for (b in 0 until n0) {
            var msk = 0
            for ((idxSig, sig) in sigList.withIndex()) if (((sig ushr b) and 1L) != 0L) msk = msk or (1 shl idxSig)
            if (msk == 0) continue
            if ((msk and forbid) != 0) continue
            tmpMasks.add(msk)
            val list = ArrayList<Int>()
            var t = msk
            var j = 0
            while (t != 0) { if ((t and 1) != 0) list.add(j); t = t ushr 1; j++ }
            tmpRows.add(list.toIntArray())
        }
        // Feasibility: every positive class must be coverable
        for (i in 0 until m) if (classTargets[i] > 0) {
            var any = false
            for (msk in tmpMasks) if (((msk ushr i) and 1) != 0) { any = true; break }
            if (!any) return false
        }
        // Merge duplicate masks
        val seen = LinkedHashMap<Int, Int>()
        val mergedM = ArrayList<Int>()
        val mergedR = ArrayList<IntArray>()
        for (idxBtn in tmpMasks.indices) {
            val msk = tmpMasks[idxBtn]
            if (!seen.containsKey(msk)) {
                seen[msk] = mergedM.size
                mergedM.add(msk)
                mergedR.add(tmpRows[idxBtn])
            }
        }
        // Sort by coverage size desc
        val order = (0 until mergedM.size).sortedByDescending { Integer.bitCount(mergedM[it]) }
        n = order.size
        masks = IntArray(n)
        rowsOf = Array(n) { IntArray(0) }
        for (k in 0 until n) { val b = order[k]; masks[k] = mergedM[b]; rowsOf[k] = mergedR[b] }
        // Precompute cap[T]
        val M = 1 shl m
        cap = IntArray(M)
        for (T in 1 until M) {
            var best = 0
            for (b in 0 until n) {
                val v = Integer.bitCount(masks[b] and T)
                if (v > best) { best = v; if (best == Integer.bitCount(T)) break }
            }
            cap[T] = best
        }
        // Precompute subset idx arrays
        subsetIdxs = Array(1 shl m) { IntArray(0) }
        for (T in 1 until (1 shl m)) {
            val list = ArrayList<Int>()
            var t = T
            var irow = 0
            while (t != 0) {
                if ((t and 1) != 0) list.add(irow)
                t = t ushr 1
                irow++
            }
            subsetIdxs[T] = list.toIntArray()
        }
        // store targets
        targetClasses = classTargets
        return true
    }

    private lateinit var targetClasses: IntArray

    private fun heuristic(rem: IntArray): Int {
        val M = cap.size
        var best = 0
        for (T in 1 until M) {
            val c = cap[T]
            if (c == 0) continue
            var s = 0
            val idxs = subsetIdxs[T]
            for (i in idxs) s += rem[i]
            if (s == 0) continue
            val v = (s + c - 1) / c
            if (v > best) best = v
        }
        return best
    }

    fun solve(): Int {
        if (!build()) return Int.MAX_VALUE
        val start = targetClasses
        // A* search
        data class Node(val g: Int, val f: Int, val rem: IntArray)
        val pq = PriorityQueue<Node>(compareBy<Node> { it.f }.thenBy { it.g })
        val seen = HashMap<IntArrayKey, Int>() // rem -> best g
        val g0 = 0
        val h0 = heuristic(start)
        pq.add(Node(g0, g0 + h0, start.clone()))
        seen[IntArrayKey(start.clone())] = 0
        while (pq.isNotEmpty()) {
            val cur = pq.poll()
            val rem = cur.rem
            // goal?
            var done = true
            for (x in rem) if (x != 0) { done = false; break }
            if (done) return cur.g
            // expand neighbors by pressing buttons that don't overshoot
            for (b in 0 until n) {
                val rows = rowsOf[b]
                var ok = true
                for (r in rows) if (rem[r] == 0) { ok = false; break }
                if (!ok) continue
                val next = rem.clone()
                for (r in rows) next[r]--
                val ng = cur.g + 1
                val key = IntArrayKey(next)
                val pg = seen[key]
                if (pg != null && ng >= pg) continue
                val nf = ng + heuristic(next)
                pq.add(Node(ng, nf, next))
                seen[key] = ng
            }
        }
        return Int.MAX_VALUE
    }
}

fun main() {
    val text = File("input.txt").readText().trim().lines().filter { it.isNotBlank() }
    var total1 = 0
    var total2 = 0
    for (line in text) {
        val (pattern, buttons, jolts) = parseLine(line)
        total1 += mitmMinPresses(pattern, buttons)
        val p2 = Part2AStar(buttons, jolts.toIntArray()).solve()
        total2 += p2
    }
    println(total1)
    println(total2)
}

import java.io.File

fun parseLine(line: String): Triple<String, List<List<Int>>, List<Int>> {
    val l = line.trim()
    val m = Regex("\\s*\\[([^\\]]+)\\]\\s*(.*)\\{([^\\}]*)\\}\\s*").matchEntire(l)
        ?: throw IllegalArgumentException("Cannot parse line: $line")
    val pattern = m.groupValues[1]
    val middle = m.groupValues[2]
    val joltsStr = m.groupValues[3].trim()
    val buttons = mutableListOf<List<Int>>()
    val par = Regex("\\(([^\\)]*)\\)")
    for (mt in par.findAll(middle)) {
        val s = mt.groupValues[1].trim()
        if (s.isEmpty()) buttons.add(emptyList()) else buttons.add(s.split(',').map { it.trim().toInt() })
    }
    val joltages = if (joltsStr.isEmpty()) emptyList() else joltsStr.split(',').map { it.trim().toInt() }
    return Triple(pattern, buttons, joltages)
}

fun mitmMinPresses(pattern: String, buttons: List<List<Int>>): Int {
    val m = pattern.length
    var target = 0
    for (i in 0 until m) if (pattern[i] == '#') target = target or (1 shl i)
    val masks = IntArray(buttons.size)
    for (i in buttons.indices) {
        var mask = 0
        for (idx in buttons[i]) if (idx in 0 until m) mask = mask xor (1 shl idx)
        masks[i] = mask
    }
    val n = masks.size
    val k = n / 2
    val left = masks.sliceArray(0 until k)
    val right = masks.sliceArray(k until n)
    val mapR = HashMap<Int, Int>()
    val Rn = right.size
    for (s in 0 until (1 shl Rn)) {
        var x = 0
        var cnt = 0
        var t = s
        var j = 0
        while (j < Rn) {
            if ((t and 1) != 0) { x = x xor right[j]; cnt++ }
            t = t ushr 1
            j++
        }
        val prev = mapR[x]
        if (prev == null || cnt < prev) mapR[x] = cnt
    }
    var best: Int? = null
    val Ln = left.size
    for (s in 0 until (1 shl Ln)) {
        var x = 0
        var cnt = 0
        var t = s
        var j = 0
        while (j < Ln) {
            if ((t and 1) != 0) { x = x xor left[j]; cnt++ }
            t = t ushr 1
            j++
        }
        val need = x xor target
        val r = mapR[need]
        if (r != null) {
            val total = cnt + r
            if (best == null || total < best!!) best = total
        }
    }
    return best ?: if (target == 0) 0 else Int.MAX_VALUE
}

class Part2IDA(buttons: List<List<Int>>, private val targets: IntArray) {
    private val m = targets.size
    private val n = buttons.size
    private val rowsOf: Array<IntArray>
    private val width: IntArray
    private val buttonsByRow: Array<IntArray>
    private val maxw: Int
    private val d2: Array<IntArray>

    init {
        val tmpRows = Array(n) { ArrayList<Int>() }
        for (b in 0 until n) {
            for (idx in buttons[b]) if (idx in 0 until m) tmpRows[b].add(idx)
        }
        rowsOf = Array(n) { tmpRows[it].toIntArray() }
        width = IntArray(n) { rowsOf[it].size }
        var w = 0
        for (x in width) if (x > w) w = x
        maxw = w
        // buttons by row
        buttonsByRow = Array(m) { IntArray(0) }
        for (i in 0 until m) {
            val list = ArrayList<Int>()
            for (b in 0 until n) {
                var found = false
                for (r in rowsOf[b]) if (r == i) { found = true; break }
                if (found) list.add(b)
            }
            list.sortWith(compareByDescending { width[it] })
            buttonsByRow[i] = list.toIntArray()
        }
        // d2
        d2 = Array(m) { IntArray(m) }
        for (i in 0 until m) {
            for (j in 0 until m) {
                var best = 0
                for (b in 0 until n) {
                    var v = 0
                    for (r in rowsOf[b]) if (r == i || r == j) v++
                    if (v > best) { best = v; if (best == 2) break }
                }
                if (best == 0) best = 1
                d2[i][j] = best
            }
        }
    }

    private fun lb(rem: IntArray): Int {
        var sum = 0
        var mx = 0
        for (x in rem) { sum += x; if (x > mx) mx = x }
        val lbSum = if (maxw == 0) 0 else (sum + maxw - 1) / maxw
        var lbPair = 0
        for (i in 0 until m) {
            val ri = rem[i]
            if (ri == 0) continue
            for (j in i + 1 until m) {
                val rj = rem[j]
                if (rj == 0) continue
                val den = d2[i][j]
                val v = (ri + rj + den - 1) / den
                if (v > lbPair) lbPair = v
            }
        }
        return maxOf(lbSum, mx, lbPair)
    }

    private fun allZero(rem: IntArray): Boolean { for (x in rem) if (x != 0) return false; return true }

    private fun dfs(rem: IntArray, g: Int, limit: Int): Int {
        if (allZero(rem)) return -1
        val h = lb(rem)
        val f = g + h
        if (f > limit) return f
        // choose pivot
        var pivot = 0
        var bestv = -1
        for (i in 0 until m) if (rem[i] > bestv) { bestv = rem[i]; pivot = i }
        if (bestv <= 0) return Int.MAX_VALUE
        var bestOver = Int.MAX_VALUE
        val cands = buttonsByRow[pivot]
        for (bi in cands) {
            val rows = rowsOf[bi]
            var ok = true
            for (r in rows) if (rem[r] == 0) { ok = false; break }
            if (!ok) continue
            for (r in rows) rem[r]--
            val res = dfs(rem, g + 1, limit)
            for (r in rows) rem[r]++
            if (res == -1) return -1
            if (res < bestOver) bestOver = res
        }
        return bestOver
    }

    fun solve(): Int {
        // quick feasibility: any positive row must have at least one button covering it
        for (i in 0 until m) if (targets[i] > 0) {
            var any = false
            for (b in 0 until n) {
                for (r in rowsOf[b]) if (r == i) { any = true; break }
                if (any) break
            }
            if (!any) return Int.MAX_VALUE
        }
        val rem0 = targets.clone()
        var limit = lb(rem0)
        while (true) {
            val res = dfs(rem0, 0, limit)
            if (res == -1) return limit
            if (res == Int.MAX_VALUE) {
                limit += 1
            } else {
                limit = res
            }
        }
    }
}

fun main() {
    val text = File("input.txt").readText().trim().lines().filter { it.isNotBlank() }
    var total1 = 0
    var total2 = 0
    for (line in text) {
        val (pattern, buttons, jolts) = parseLine(line)
        total1 += mitmMinPresses(pattern, buttons)
        total2 += Part2IDA(buttons, jolts.toIntArray()).solve()
    }
    println(total1)
    println(total2)
}

// Simplex for: maximize c^T y, subject to A y <= b, y >= 0.
class Simplex(private val A: Array<DoubleArray>, private val b: DoubleArray, private val c: DoubleArray) {
    // Returns Pair(optVal, solution y) or null if infeasible/unbounded (shouldn't happen here)
    fun solve(): Pair<Double, DoubleArray>? {
        val m = A.size // number of constraints
        val n = c.size // number of variables
        // Build tableau of size (m+1) x (n + m + 1)
        val W = Array(m + 1) { DoubleArray(n + m + 1) }
        // constraints: A y + I s = b
        for (i in 0 until m) {
            for (j in 0 until n) W[i][j] = A[i][j]
            W[i][n + i] = 1.0
            W[i][n + m] = b[i]
        }
        // objective: -c^T y + 0*s + z = 0  (we store negative for maximization)
        for (j in 0 until n) W[m][j] = -c[j]
        // Basis: slack variables initially
        val basis = IntArray(m) { n + it }
        val EPS = 1e-9
        fun pivot(row: Int, col: Int) {
            val piv = W[row][col]
            for (j in 0 until W[0].size) W[row][j] /= piv
            for (i in 0..m) if (i != row) {
                val factor = W[i][col]
                if (abs(factor) > EPS) {
                    for (j in 0 until W[0].size) W[i][j] -= factor * W[row][j]
                }
            }
            basis[row] = col
        }
        while (true) {
            // choose entering variable: most negative reduced cost
            var col = -1
            var mostNeg = 0.0
            for (j in 0 until n + m) {
                if (W[m][j] < mostNeg - EPS) { mostNeg = W[m][j]; col = j }
            }
            if (col == -1) break // optimal
            // choose leaving variable by minimum ratio test
            var row = -1
            var best = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY
            for (i in 0 until m) {
                val aij = W[i][col]
                if (aij > EPS) {
                    val ratio = W[i][n + m] / aij
                    if (ratio < best - EPS) { best = ratio; row = i }
                }
            }
            if (row == -1) return null // unbounded
            pivot(row, col)
        }
        val y = DoubleArray(n)
        for (i in 0 until m) {
            val varIdx = basis[i]
            if (varIdx < n) y[varIdx] = W[i][n + m]
        }
        val value = W[m][n + m]
        return Pair(value, y)
    }
}

fun part2LP(buttons: List<List<Int>>, targets: IntArray): Int {
    val m = targets.size
    // Build unique button masks
    val maskSet = LinkedHashSet<Int>()
    for (b in buttons) {
        var mask = 0
        for (idx in b) if (idx in 0 until m) mask = mask or (1 shl idx)
        if (mask != 0) maskSet.add(mask)
    }
    // Remove masks that touch any zero-target row (can't be used in integer solution), but in LP dual, constraints correspond to available buttons; removing such masks relaxes the dual (fewer constraints), increasing objective and making lower bound too high. However, any integer solution cannot use those buttons, so primal feasible set is reduced. Dual should include only constraints for buttons we allow to use. So we must filter masks that touch zero-target rows.
    val filtered = maskSet.filter { mask ->
        var ok = true
        for (i in 0 until m) if (((mask ushr i) and 1) != 0 && targets[i] == 0) { ok = false; break }
        ok
    }
    val A = Array(filtered.size) { DoubleArray(m) }
    val b = DoubleArray(filtered.size) { 1.0 }
    var r = 0
    for (mask in filtered) {
        for (i in 0 until m) A[r][i] = if (((mask ushr i) and 1) != 0) 1.0 else 0.0
        r++
    }
    val c = DoubleArray(m) { targets[it].toDouble() }
    val simplex = Simplex(A, b, c)
    val res = simplex.solve() ?: return Int.MAX_VALUE
    val valOpt = res.first
    // Round to nearest int with epsilon
    val ans = Math.round(valOpt).toInt()
    return ans
}

fun main() {
    val text = File("input.txt").readText().trim().lines().filter { it.isNotBlank() }
    var total1 = 0
    var total2 = 0
    for (line in text) {
        val (pattern, buttons, jolts) = parseLine(line)
        total1 += mitmMinPresses(pattern, buttons)
        total2 += part2LP(buttons, jolts.toIntArray())
    }
    println(total1)
    println(total2)
}

// Solve one connected component exactly by branching on button multiplicities with strong bounds.
private class CompSolver(private val masks: IntArray, private val rowsOf: Array<IntArray>, private val targets: IntArray) {
    private val n = masks.size
    private val m = targets.size
    private val M = 1 shl m
    private val capsSuffix: Array<IntArray> = Array(n + 1) { IntArray(M) }
    private val sumT = IntArray(M)
    private var best = Int.MAX_VALUE

    init {
        // Precompute caps for suffixes of buttons
        for (d in n - 1 downTo 0) {
            val cur = capsSuffix[d]
            val nxt = capsSuffix[d + 1]
            val maskB = masks[d]
            for (T in 1 until M) {
                val cov = Integer.bitCount(maskB and T)
                val v = nxt[T]
                cur[T] = if (cov > v) cov else v
            }
        }
        // Initialize sumT from targets
        for (i in 0 until m) if (targets[i] != 0) {
            val bit = 1 shl i
            var T = bit
            while (T < M) {
                sumT[T] += targets[i]
                T = (T + 1) or bit
            }
        }
    }

    private fun allZero(a: IntArray): Boolean { for (x in a) if (x != 0) return false; return true }

    private fun lb(depth: Int): Int {
        val cap = capsSuffix[depth]
        var bestLb = 0
        for (T in 1 until M) {
            val s = sumT[T]
            if (s == 0) continue
            val c = cap[T]
            if (c == 0) return Int.MAX_VALUE
            val need = (s + c - 1) / c
            if (need > bestLb) bestLb = need
        }
        return bestLb
    }

    private fun apply(b: Int, k: Int, rem: IntArray) {
        if (k == 0) return
        for (r in rowsOf[b]) rem[r] -= k
        // update sumT by subtracting k * ct[b][T]
        // compute ct on the fly by checking if subset contains each r
        for (T in 1 until M) {
            var cnt = 0
            for (r in rowsOf[b]) if (((T ushr r) and 1) != 0) cnt++
            if (cnt != 0) sumT[T] -= cnt * k
        }
    }
    private fun undo(b: Int, k: Int, rem: IntArray) {
        if (k == 0) return
        for (r in rowsOf[b]) rem[r] += k
        for (T in 1 until M) {
            var cnt = 0
            for (r in rowsOf[b]) if (((T ushr r) and 1) != 0) cnt++
            if (cnt != 0) sumT[T] += cnt * k
        }
    }

    private fun dfs(depth: Int, used: Int, rem: IntArray) {
        if (used >= best) return
        val h = lb(depth)
        if (h == Int.MAX_VALUE) return
        if (used + h >= best) return
        if (depth == n) {
            if (allZero(rem)) best = used
            return
        }
        // upper bound for this button: limited by min rem over its rows
        var ub = Int.MAX_VALUE
        for (r in rowsOf[depth]) if (rem[r] < ub) ub = rem[r]
        if (ub == Int.MAX_VALUE) ub = 0
        // try large k first for faster convergence
        var k = ub
        while (k >= 0) {
            apply(depth, k, rem)
            dfs(depth + 1, used + k, rem)
            undo(depth, k, rem)
            k--
        }
    }

    fun solve(): Int {
        val rem = targets.clone()
        best = 1_000_000_000
        dfs(0, 0, rem)
        return best
    }
}

fun solveMachinePart2(buttonsOrig: List<List<Int>>, targetsOrig: IntArray): Int {
    val m0 = targetsOrig.size
    val n0 = buttonsOrig.size
    if (m0 == 0) return 0
    // Build cover matrix
    val cover = Array(n0) { BooleanArray(m0) }
    for (b in 0 until n0) for (idx in buttonsOrig[b]) if (idx in 0 until m0) cover[b][idx] = true
    // Group rows by signature
    val sigToRows = LinkedHashMap<Long, MutableList<Int>>()
    for (i in 0 until m0) {
        var sig = 0L
        for (b in 0 until n0) if (cover[b][i]) sig = sig or (1L shl b)
        sigToRows.computeIfAbsent(sig) { ArrayList() }.add(i)
    }
    val m = sigToRows.size
    // Build class targets and check consistency
    val classTargets = IntArray(m)
    val sigList = ArrayList<Long>(m)
    var ci = 0
    for ((sig, rows) in sigToRows) {
        sigList.add(sig)
        val t0 = targetsOrig[rows[0]]
        for (r in rows) if (targetsOrig[r] != t0) return Int.MAX_VALUE
        classTargets[ci] = t0
        ci++
    }
    // Forbid buttons touching zero-target classes
    var forbid = 0
    for (i in 0 until m) if (classTargets[i] == 0) forbid = forbid or (1 shl i)
    // Build button masks over classes; drop useless
    val tmpMasks = ArrayList<Int>()
    val tmpRows = ArrayList<IntArray>()
    for (b in 0 until n0) {
        var msk = 0
        for ((idxSig, sig) in sigList.withIndex()) if (((sig ushr b) and 1L) != 0L) msk = msk or (1 shl idxSig)
        if (msk == 0) continue
        if ((msk and forbid) != 0) continue
        tmpMasks.add(msk)
        val list = ArrayList<Int>()
        var t = msk
        var j = 0
        while (t != 0) { if ((t and 1) != 0) list.add(j); t = t ushr 1; j++ }
        tmpRows.add(list.toIntArray())
    }
    // Feasibility: every positive class must be coverable
    for (i in 0 until m) if (classTargets[i] > 0) {
        var any = false
        for (msk in tmpMasks) if (((msk ushr i) and 1) != 0) { any = true; break }
        if (!any) return Int.MAX_VALUE
    }
    // Merge duplicate button masks
    val seen = LinkedHashMap<Int, Int>()
    val mergedM = ArrayList<Int>()
    val mergedR = ArrayList<IntArray>()
    for (idxBtn in tmpMasks.indices) {
        val msk = tmpMasks[idxBtn]
        if (!seen.containsKey(msk)) {
            seen[msk] = mergedM.size
            mergedM.add(msk)
            mergedR.add(tmpRows[idxBtn])
        }
    }
    // If no buttons remain but all targets are zero -> 0, else infeasible
    if (mergedM.isEmpty()) return if (classTargets.all { it == 0 }) 0 else Int.MAX_VALUE
    // Build connectivity among classes
    val adj = Array(m) { ArrayList<Int>() }
    for (msk in mergedM) {
        // connect all set bits in this mask
        val bits = ArrayList<Int>()
        var t = msk
        var i = 0
        while (t != 0) { if ((t and 1) != 0) bits.add(i); t = t ushr 1; i++ }
        for (a in 0 until bits.size) for (b in a + 1 until bits.size) {
            val u = bits[a]; val v = bits[b]
            adj[u].add(v); adj[v].add(u)
        }
    }
    // Compute components via BFS
    val compId = IntArray(m) { -1 }
    var comps = 0
    for (i in 0 until m) if (compId[i] == -1) {
        val q = ArrayDeque<Int>()
        q.add(i)
        compId[i] = comps
        while (q.isNotEmpty()) {
            val u = q.removeFirst()
            for (v in adj[u]) if (compId[v] == -1) { compId[v] = comps; q.add(v) }
        }
        comps++
    }
    // Build per-component subproblems
    var total = 0
    for (c in 0 until comps) {
        // collect classes in this component
        val idxMap = HashMap<Int, Int>()
        var mc = 0
        for (i in 0 until m) if (compId[i] == c) { idxMap[i] = mc; mc++ }
        val targ = IntArray(mc)
        for ((orig, ni) in idxMap) targ[ni] = classTargets[orig]
        // collect buttons wholly inside this component
        val masksC = ArrayList<Int>()
        val rowsC = ArrayList<IntArray>()
        for (b in mergedM.indices) {
            val mask = mergedM[b]
            var ok = true
            var t = mask
            var iBit = 0
            while (t != 0) {
                if ((t and 1) != 0) if (compId[iBit] != c) { ok = false; break }
                t = t ushr 1
                iBit++
            }
            if (!ok) continue
            // remap mask to component-local indices
            var newMask = 0
            val list = ArrayList<Int>()
            var tt = mask
            var ii = 0
            while (tt != 0) {
                if ((tt and 1) != 0) { val ni = idxMap[ii]!!; newMask = newMask or (1 shl ni); list.add(ni) }
                tt = tt ushr 1
                ii++
            }
            masksC.add(newMask)
            rowsC.add(list.toIntArray())
        }
        // sort buttons by coverage size desc
        val order = (0 until masksC.size).sortedByDescending { Integer.bitCount(masksC[it]) }
        val masksArr = IntArray(order.size)
        val rowsArr = Array(order.size) { IntArray(0) }
        for (k in order.indices) { masksArr[k] = masksC[order[k]]; rowsArr[k] = rowsC[order[k]] }
        val solver = CompSolver(masksArr, rowsArr, targ)
        val ans = solver.solve()
        if (ans == Int.MAX_VALUE) return Int.MAX_VALUE
        total += ans
    }
    return total
}

fun main() {
    val text = File("input.txt").readText().trim().lines().filter { it.isNotBlank() }
    var total1 = 0
    var total2 = 0
    for (line in text) {
        val (pattern, buttons, jolts) = parseLine(line)
        total1 += mitmMinPresses(pattern, buttons)
        total2 += solveMachinePart2(buttons, jolts.toIntArray())
    }
    println(total1)
    println(total2)
}

import java.io.File
import java.util.ArrayDeque

fun parseLine(line: String): Triple<String, List<List<Int>>, List<Int>> {
    val l = line.trim()
    val m = Regex("\\s*\\[([^\\]]+)\\]\\s*(.*)\\{([^\\}]*)\\}\\s*").matchEntire(l)
        ?: throw IllegalArgumentException("Cannot parse line: $line")
    val pattern = m.groupValues[1]
    val middle = m.groupValues[2]
    val joltsStr = m.groupValues[3].trim()
    val buttons = mutableListOf<List<Int>>()
    val par = Regex("\\(([^\\)]*)\\)")
    for (mt in par.findAll(middle)) {
        val s = mt.groupValues[1].trim()
        if (s.isEmpty()) buttons.add(emptyList()) else buttons.add(s.split(',').map { it.trim().toInt() })
    }
    val joltages = if (joltsStr.isEmpty()) emptyList() else joltsStr.split(',').map { it.trim().toInt() }
    return Triple(pattern, buttons, joltages)
}

fun mitmMinPresses(pattern: String, buttons: List<List<Int>>): Int {
    val m = pattern.length
    var target = 0
    for (i in 0 until m) if (pattern[i] == '#') target = target or (1 shl i)
    val masks = IntArray(buttons.size)
    for (i in buttons.indices) {
        var mask = 0
        for (idx in buttons[i]) if (idx in 0 until m) mask = mask xor (1 shl idx)
        masks[i] = mask
    }
    val n = masks.size
    val k = n / 2
    val left = masks.sliceArray(0 until k)
    val right = masks.sliceArray(k until n)
    val mapR = HashMap<Int, Int>()
    val Rn = right.size
    for (s in 0 until (1 shl Rn)) {
        var x = 0
        var cnt = 0
        var t = s
        var j = 0
        while (j < Rn) {
            if ((t and 1) != 0) { x = x xor right[j]; cnt++ }
            t = t ushr 1
            j++
        }
        val prev = mapR[x]
        if (prev == null || cnt < prev) mapR[x] = cnt
    }
    var best: Int? = null
    val Ln = left.size
    for (s in 0 until (1 shl Ln)) {
        var x = 0
        var cnt = 0
        var t = s
        var j = 0
        while (j < Ln) {
            if ((t and 1) != 0) { x = x xor left[j]; cnt++ }
            t = t ushr 1
            j++
        }
        val need = x xor target
        val r = mapR[need]
        if (r != null) {
            val total = cnt + r
            if (best == null || total < best!!) best = total
        }
    }
    return best ?: if (target == 0) 0 else Int.MAX_VALUE
}

private class CompSolver(private val masks: IntArray, private val rowsOf: Array<IntArray>, private val targets: IntArray) {
    private val n = masks.size
    private val m = targets.size
    private val M = 1 shl m
    private val capsSuffix: Array<IntArray> = Array(n + 1) { IntArray(M) }
    private val ct: Array<IntArray> = Array(n) { IntArray(M) }
    private val sumT: IntArray = IntArray(M)
    private val rem: IntArray = targets.clone()
    private var best = Int.MAX_VALUE
    private val memo = HashMap<Long, Int>()

    init {
        // Precompute caps for suffixes and ct[b][T]
        for (d in n - 1 downTo 0) {
            val cur = capsSuffix[d]
            val nxt = capsSuffix[d + 1]
            val maskB = masks[d]
            for (T in 1 until M) {
                val cov = Integer.bitCount(maskB and T)
                val v = nxt[T]
                cur[T] = if (cov > v) cov else v
            }
        }
        for (b in 0 until n) {
            val mb = masks[b]
            for (T in 1 until M) ct[b][T] = Integer.bitCount(mb and T)
        }
        // Initialize sumT from targets
        for (T in 1 until M) {
            var s = 0
            var t = T
            var i = 0
            while (t != 0) {
                if ((t and 1) != 0) s += targets[i]
                t = t ushr 1
                i++
            }
            sumT[T] = s
        }
    }

    private fun allZero(): Boolean { for (x in rem) if (x != 0) return false; return true }

    private fun lb(depth: Int): Int {
        val cap = capsSuffix[depth]
        var bestLb = 0
        for (T in 1 until M) {
            val s = sumT[T]
            if (s == 0) continue
            val c = cap[T]
            if (c == 0) return Int.MAX_VALUE
            val need = (s + c - 1) / c
            if (need > bestLb) bestLb = need
        }
        return bestLb
    }

    private fun apply(b: Int, k: Int) {
        if (k == 0) return
        for (r in rowsOf[b]) rem[r] -= k
        val cb = ct[b]
        for (T in 1 until M) {
            val c = cb[T]
            if (c != 0) sumT[T] -= c * k
        }
    }
    private fun undo(b: Int, k: Int) {
        if (k == 0) return
        for (r in rowsOf[b]) rem[r] += k
        val cb = ct[b]
        for (T in 1 until M) {
            val c = cb[T]
            if (c != 0) sumT[T] += c * k
        }
    }

    private fun key(depth: Int): Long {
        // pack depth in high bits and rem (each up to maybe ~300) in base 512
        var h = depth.toLong() shl 54
        var acc = 0L
        for (i in 0 until m) {
            acc = acc * 521 + rem[i]
        }
        return h xor acc
    }

    private fun dfs(depth: Int, used: Int) {
        if (used >= best) return
        if (allZero()) { if (used < best) best = used; return }
        val h = lb(depth)
        if (h == Int.MAX_VALUE) return
        if (used + h >= best) return
        if (depth == n) return
        val kKey = key(depth)
        val prev = memo[kKey]
        if (prev != null && used >= prev) return
        memo[kKey] = used
        // upper bound for this button
        var ub = Int.MAX_VALUE
        for (r in rowsOf[depth]) if (rem[r] < ub) ub = rem[r]
        if (ub == Int.MAX_VALUE) ub = 0
        var k = ub
        while (k >= 0) {
            apply(depth, k)
            dfs(depth + 1, used + k)
            undo(depth, k)
            k--
        }
    }

    fun solve(): Int {
        dfs(0, 0)
        return best
    }
}

fun solveMachinePart2(buttonsOrig: List<List<Int>>, targetsOrig: IntArray): Int {
    val m0 = targetsOrig.size
    val n0 = buttonsOrig.size
    if (m0 == 0) return 0
    // Build cover matrix
    val cover = Array(n0) { BooleanArray(m0) }
    for (b in 0 until n0) for (idx in buttonsOrig[b]) if (idx in 0 until m0) cover[b][idx] = true
    // Group rows by signature over buttons
    val sigToRows = LinkedHashMap<Long, MutableList<Int>>()
    for (i in 0 until m0) {
        var sig = 0L
        for (b in 0 until n0) if (cover[b][i]) sig = sig or (1L shl b)
        sigToRows.computeIfAbsent(sig) { ArrayList() }.add(i)
    }
    val m = sigToRows.size
    val classTargets = IntArray(m)
    val sigList = ArrayList<Long>(m)
    var ci = 0
    for ((sig, rows) in sigToRows) {
        sigList.add(sig)
        val t0 = targetsOrig[rows[0]]
        for (r in rows) if (targetsOrig[r] != t0) return Int.MAX_VALUE
        classTargets[ci] = t0
        ci++
    }
    // Forbid buttons touching zero-target classes
    var forbid = 0
    for (i in 0 until m) if (classTargets[i] == 0) forbid = forbid or (1 shl i)
    // Build button masks over classes, keep those not touching forbidden
    val maskList = ArrayList<Int>()
    val rowsList = ArrayList<IntArray>()
    for (b in 0 until n0) {
        var msk = 0
        for ((idxSig, sig) in sigList.withIndex()) if (((sig ushr b) and 1L) != 0L) msk = msk or (1 shl idxSig)
        if (msk == 0) continue
        if ((msk and forbid) != 0) continue
        val list = ArrayList<Int>()
        var t = msk
        var j = 0
        while (t != 0) { if ((t and 1) != 0) list.add(j); t = t ushr 1; j++ }
        maskList.add(msk)
        rowsList.add(list.toIntArray())
    }
    // Feasibility: every positive class must be coverable
    for (i in 0 until m) if (classTargets[i] > 0) {
        var any = false
        for (msk in maskList) if (((msk ushr i) and 1) != 0) { any = true; break }
        if (!any) return Int.MAX_VALUE
    }
    if (maskList.isEmpty()) return if (classTargets.all { it == 0 }) 0 else Int.MAX_VALUE
    // Merge duplicate masks
    val seen = LinkedHashMap<Int, Int>()
    val mergedM = ArrayList<Int>()
    val mergedR = ArrayList<IntArray>()
    for (idxBtn in maskList.indices) {
        val msk = maskList[idxBtn]
        if (!seen.containsKey(msk)) { seen[msk] = mergedM.size; mergedM.add(msk); mergedR.add(rowsList[idxBtn]) }
    }
    // Build connectivity among classes
    val adj = Array(m) { ArrayList<Int>() }
    for (msk in mergedM) {
        val bits = ArrayList<Int>()
        var t = msk
        var i = 0
        while (t != 0) { if ((t and 1) != 0) bits.add(i); t = t ushr 1; i++ }
        for (a in 0 until bits.size) for (b in a + 1 until bits.size) { val u = bits[a]; val v = bits[b]; adj[u].add(v); adj[v].add(u) }
    }
    // BFS components
    val comp = IntArray(m) { -1 }
    var comps = 0
    for (i in 0 until m) if (comp[i] == -1) {
        val q = ArrayDeque<Int>()
        q.add(i)
        comp[i] = comps
        while (q.isNotEmpty()) {
            val u = q.removeFirst()
            for (v in adj[u]) if (comp[v] == -1) { comp[v] = comps; q.add(v) }
        }
        comps++
    }
    var total = 0
    for (c in 0 until comps) {
        val idxMap = HashMap<Int, Int>()
        var mc = 0
        for (i in 0 until m) if (comp[i] == c) { idxMap[i] = mc; mc++ }
        val targ = IntArray(mc)
        for ((oi, ni) in idxMap) targ[ni] = classTargets[oi]
        val masksC = ArrayList<Int>()
        val rowsC = ArrayList<IntArray>()
        for (mi in mergedM.indices) {
            val mask = mergedM[mi]
            var ok = true
            var t = mask
            var iBit = 0
            while (t != 0) {
                if ((t and 1) != 0) if (comp[iBit] != c) { ok = false; break }
                t = t ushr 1
                iBit++
            }
            if (!ok) continue
            var newMask = 0
            val list = ArrayList<Int>()
            var tt = mask
            var ii = 0
            while (tt != 0) {
                if ((tt and 1) != 0) { val ni = idxMap[ii]!!; newMask = newMask or (1 shl ni); list.add(ni) }
                tt = tt ushr 1
                ii++
            }
            masksC.add(newMask)
            rowsC.add(list.toIntArray())
        }
        // sort buttons by coverage size desc
        val order = (0 until masksC.size).sortedByDescending { Integer.bitCount(masksC[it]) }
        val masksArr = IntArray(order.size)
        val rowsArr = Array(order.size) { IntArray(0) }
        for (k in order.indices) { masksArr[k] = masksC[order[k]]; rowsArr[k] = rowsC[order[k]] }
        val solver = CompSolver(masksArr, rowsArr, targ)
        val ans = solver.solve()
        if (ans == Int.MAX_VALUE) return Int.MAX_VALUE
        total += ans
    }
    return total
}

fun main() {
    val lines = File("input.txt").readText().trim().lines().filter { it.isNotBlank() }
    var total1 = 0
    var total2 = 0
    for (line in lines) {
        val (pattern, buttons, jolts) = parseLine(line)
        total1 += mitmMinPresses(pattern, buttons)
        total2 += solveMachinePart2(buttons, jolts.toIntArray())
    }
    println(total1)
    println(total2)
}

private class CompSolver(private val masks: IntArray, private val rowsOf: Array<IntArray>, private val targets: IntArray) {
    private val n = masks.size
    private val m = targets.size
    private val M = 1 shl m
    private val capsSuffix: Array<IntArray> = Array(n + 1) { IntArray(M) }
    private val ct: Array<IntArray> = Array(n) { IntArray(M) }
    private val sumT: IntArray = IntArray(M)
    private val rem: IntArray = targets.clone()
    private var best = Int.MAX_VALUE
    private val memo = HashMap<Long, Int>()

    init {
        // caps suffix
        for (d in n - 1 downTo 0) {
            val cur = capsSuffix[d]
            val nxt = capsSuffix[d + 1]
            val maskB = masks[d]
            for (T in 1 until M) {
                val cov = Integer.bitCount(maskB and T)
                val v = nxt[T]
                cur[T] = if (cov > v) cov else v
            }
        }
        // ct[b][T]
        for (b in 0 until n) {
            val mb = masks[b]
            for (T in 1 until M) ct[b][T] = Integer.bitCount(mb and T)
        }
        // sumT initial
        for (T in 1 until M) {
            var s = 0
            var t = T
            var i = 0
            while (t != 0) {
                if ((t and 1) != 0) s += targets[i]
                t = t ushr 1
                i++
            }
            sumT[T] = s
        }
    }

    private fun allZero(): Boolean { for (x in rem) if (x != 0) return false; return true }

    private fun lb(depth: Int): Int {
        val cap = capsSuffix[depth]
        var bestLb = 0
        for (T in 1 until M) {
            val s = sumT[T]
            if (s == 0) continue
            val c = cap[T]
            if (c == 0) return Int.MAX_VALUE
            val need = (s + c - 1) / c
            if (need > bestLb) bestLb = need
        }
        return bestLb
    }

    private fun greedyUB(): Int {
        // Bit decomposition upper bound using greedy set cover per bit
        var ub = 0
        val masksList = masks
        // Precompute list of rows per mask for fast check
        for (bit in 0..20) {
            val rowsNeeded = ArrayList<Int>()
            for (i in 0 until m) if (((rem[i] ushr bit) and 1) != 0) rowsNeeded.add(i)
            if (rowsNeeded.isEmpty()) continue
            var cnt = 0
            val need = BooleanArray(m)
            for (r in rowsNeeded) need[r] = true
            var left = rowsNeeded.size
            while (left > 0) {
                var bestB = -1
                var bestGain = 0
                for (b in 0 until n) {
                    var gain = 0
                    val rows = rowsOf[b]
                    for (r in rows) if (need[r]) gain++
                    if (gain > bestGain) { bestGain = gain; bestB = b }
                }
                if (bestGain == 0) return Int.MAX_VALUE
                // choose bestB
                val rows = rowsOf[bestB]
                for (r in rows) if (need[r]) { need[r] = false; left-- }
                cnt++
            }
            ub += cnt shl bit
        }
        return ub
    }

    private fun apply(b: Int, k: Int) {
        if (k == 0) return
        for (r in rowsOf[b]) rem[r] -= k
        val cb = ct[b]
        for (T in 1 until M) {
            val c = cb[T]
            if (c != 0) sumT[T] -= c * k
        }
    }
    private fun undo(b: Int, k: Int) {
        if (k == 0) return
        for (r in rowsOf[b]) rem[r] += k
        val cb = ct[b]
        for (T in 1 until M) {
            val c = cb[T]
            if (c != 0) sumT[T] += c * k
        }
    }

    private fun key(depth: Int): Long {
        var h = depth.toLong() * 1469598103934665603L
        for (x in rem) h = (h xor x.toLong()) * 1099511628211L
        return h
    }

    private fun dfs(depth: Int, used: Int) {
        if (used >= best) return
        if (allZero()) { if (used < best) best = used; return }
        val h = lb(depth)
        if (h == Int.MAX_VALUE) return
        if (used + h >= best) return
        val ubLocal = greedyUB()
        if (ubLocal != Int.MAX_VALUE && used + ubLocal < best) best = used + ubLocal
        if (depth == n) return
        val kKey = key(depth)
        val prev = memo[kKey]
        if (prev != null && used >= prev) return
        memo[kKey] = used
        // upper bound for this button
        var ub = Int.MAX_VALUE
        for (r in rowsOf[depth]) if (rem[r] < ub) ub = rem[r]
        if (ub == Int.MAX_VALUE) ub = 0
        var k = ub
        while (k >= 0) {
            apply(depth, k)
            dfs(depth + 1, used + k)
            undo(depth, k)
            k--
        }
    }

    fun solve(): Int {
        best = Int.MAX_VALUE
        dfs(0, 0)
        return best
    }
}

fun solveMachinePart2(buttonsOrig: List<List<Int>>, targetsOrig: IntArray): Int {
    val m0 = targetsOrig.size
    val n0 = buttonsOrig.size
    if (m0 == 0) return 0
    // Build cover matrix
    val cover = Array(n0) { BooleanArray(m0) }
    for (b in 0 until n0) for (idx in buttonsOrig[b]) if (idx in 0 until m0) cover[b][idx] = true
    // Group rows by signature over buttons
    val sigToRows = LinkedHashMap<Long, MutableList<Int>>()
    for (i in 0 until m0) {
        var sig = 0L
        for (b in 0 until n0) if (cover[b][i]) sig = sig or (1L shl b)
        sigToRows.computeIfAbsent(sig) { ArrayList() }.add(i)
    }
    val m = sigToRows.size
    val classTargets = IntArray(m)
    val sigList = ArrayList<Long>(m)
    var ci = 0
    for ((sig, rows) in sigToRows) {
        sigList.add(sig)
        val t0 = targetsOrig[rows[0]]
        for (r in rows) if (targetsOrig[r] != t0) return Int.MAX_VALUE
        classTargets[ci] = t0
        ci++
    }
    // Forbid buttons touching zero-target classes
    var forbid = 0
    for (i in 0 until m) if (classTargets[i] == 0) forbid = forbid or (1 shl i)
    // Build button masks over classes, keep those not touching forbidden
    val maskList = ArrayList<Int>()
    val rowsList = ArrayList<IntArray>()
    for (b in 0 until n0) {
        var msk = 0
        for ((idxSig, sig) in sigList.withIndex()) if (((sig ushr b) and 1L) != 0L) msk = msk or (1 shl idxSig)
        if (msk == 0) continue
        if ((msk and forbid) != 0) continue
        val list = ArrayList<Int>()
        var t = msk
        var j = 0
        while (t != 0) { if ((t and 1) != 0) list.add(j); t = t ushr 1; j++ }
        maskList.add(msk)
        rowsList.add(list.toIntArray())
    }
    // Feasibility: every positive class must be coverable
    for (i in 0 until m) if (classTargets[i] > 0) {
        var any = false
        for (msk in maskList) if (((msk ushr i) and 1) != 0) { any = true; break }
        if (!any) return Int.MAX_VALUE
    }
    if (maskList.isEmpty()) return if (classTargets.all { it == 0 }) 0 else Int.MAX_VALUE
    // Merge duplicate masks
    val seen = LinkedHashMap<Int, Int>()
    val mergedM = ArrayList<Int>()
    val mergedR = ArrayList<IntArray>()
    for (idxBtn in maskList.indices) {
        val msk = maskList[idxBtn]
        if (!seen.containsKey(msk)) { seen[msk] = mergedM.size; mergedM.add(msk); mergedR.add(rowsList[idxBtn]) }
    }
    // Build connectivity among classes
    val adj = Array(m) { ArrayList<Int>() }
    for (msk in mergedM) {
        val bits = ArrayList<Int>()
        var t = msk
        var i = 0
        while (t != 0) { if ((t and 1) != 0) bits.add(i); t = t ushr 1; i++ }
        for (a in 0 until bits.size) for (b in a + 1 until bits.size) { val u = bits[a]; val v = bits[b]; adj[u].add(v); adj[v].add(u) }
    }
    // BFS components
    val comp = IntArray(m) { -1 }
    var comps = 0
    for (i in 0 until m) if (comp[i] == -1) {
        val q = ArrayDeque<Int>()
        q.add(i)
        comp[i] = comps
        while (q.isNotEmpty()) {
            val u = q.removeFirst()
            for (v in adj[u]) if (comp[v] == -1) { comp[v] = comps; q.add(v) }
        }
        comps++
    }
    var total = 0
    for (c in 0 until comps) {
        val idxMap = HashMap<Int, Int>()
        var mc = 0
        for (i in 0 until m) if (comp[i] == c) { idxMap[i] = mc; mc++ }
        val targ = IntArray(mc)
        for ((oi, ni) in idxMap) targ[ni] = classTargets[oi]
        val masksC = ArrayList<Int>()
        val rowsC = ArrayList<IntArray>()
        for (mi in mergedM.indices) {
            val mask = mergedM[mi]
            var ok = true
            var t = mask
            var iBit = 0
            while (t != 0) {
                if ((t and 1) != 0) if (comp[iBit] != c) { ok = false; break }
                t = t ushr 1
                iBit++
            }
            if (!ok) continue
            var newMask = 0
            val list = ArrayList<Int>()
            var tt = mask
            var ii = 0
            while (tt != 0) {
                if ((tt and 1) != 0) { val ni = idxMap[ii]!!; newMask = newMask or (1 shl ni); list.add(ni) }
                tt = tt ushr 1
                ii++
            }
            masksC.add(newMask)
            rowsC.add(list.toIntArray())
        }
        // sort buttons by coverage size desc
        val order = (0 until masksC.size).sortedByDescending { Integer.bitCount(masksC[it]) }
        val masksArr = IntArray(order.size)
        val rowsArr = Array(order.size) { IntArray(0) }
        for (k in order.indices) { masksArr[k] = masksC[order[k]]; rowsArr[k] = rowsC[order[k]] }
        val solver = CompSolver(masksArr, rowsArr, targ)
        val ans = solver.solve()
        if (ans == Int.MAX_VALUE) return Int.MAX_VALUE
        total += ans
    }
    return total
}

fun main() {
    val lines = File("input.txt").readText().trim().lines().filter { it.isNotBlank() }
    var total1 = 0
    var total2 = 0
    for (line in lines) {
        val (pattern, buttons, jolts) = parseLine(line)
        total1 += mitmMinPresses(pattern, buttons)
        total2 += solveMachinePart2(buttons, jolts.toIntArray())
    }
    println(total1)
    println(total2)
}
